resources.string: We started with just a single school serving 5,000 students in Cabanatuan City. Today, we are a fast-growing network of ten educational institutions serving over 144,000 students in the Philippines and Indonesia.

In 2024, leading global investment firm KKR began investing in PHINMA Education from its Global Impact Fund II, which targets companies whose core business contributes meaningfully towards one or more of the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs).

PHINMA Education’s mission directly contributes toward SDG 4 (Quality Education). KKR, along with our existing shareholder Kaizenvest, are just two of our many partners in making lives better through education.
Since 2004, PHINMA Education has provided quality education to underserved youth who are often the first in their families to go to college.
STUDENTS IN THE PHILIPPINES AND INDONESIA

• A combination of studying in school and studying at home.
• 2 days face-to-face and 4 days remote learning.
• Teacher support will be via text, call and social media during the remote coaching.
• Suited for regular student who live far away and have difficulties traveling to come to school.
• Learn online together with your classmates.
• Teacher support will be via text, call and social media during the remote coaching.
In our Scholarship program we provide our students 50% to 75% discount on tuition and miscellaneous fees.

Bachelor of Science in Computer Science
CITE – Bachelor of Science in Computer Science - 23-24
Mission of the PHINMA Education Network

Through the application of effective management in institutions of higher and basic learning, to give Filipinos better access to affordable, high quality education in key cities throughout the Philippines, preparing them to be globally competitive.
To develop the filipino youth into empoyable global professional thru the endowment of knowledge and skills and the formation of character and spirit.
With distinct advantage in English Communication and Information Technology, to be the leading institution of higher learning in the region in the development of globally competitive professionals.

The grading system will be provided to the students by their respective teacher through the syllabus. If understanding of the system is not clear, it is the responsibility of the student to seek clarification from his/her teacher, program head or dean.

Grades are given out in numerical format. A student who passed the subject will receive any of the following grades: 1.00, 1.25, 1.50, 1.75, 2.00. 2.25, 2.50, 2.75, 3.00. The grade of 1.00 is the highest possible grade that a student may get. A student who has failed a subject will receive a grade of 5.00.
Final grades will be released by the Office of the Registrar. Other term exams will be released by the faculty.
A student who gets anan incomplete grade has two consecutive terms to complete it. The Dean/Director must have approved the granting of the incomplete grade.

 -Recognized Student Organization

Students of the PHINMA Education Network deserve quality education. We define quality education as education that: 
 
1. provides opportunities for learning globally in-demand skills 
 
2. helps PEN Students grow and develop into mature, responsible, effective and worthy citizens of their community.

Together with the PEN Student's Right is the PEN Student's responsibilities to: 

1. live up to the standards of academic excellence and integrity. 

2. live and work according to the PEN Values.
